docs.lead_paragraph: Before it’s signed, sealed and delivered, as his campaign song goes, Barack Obama will have to balance his cool with some heat, as J.F.K. did.

docs.lead_paragraph: In Search of a Lost Africa I was delighted to read Helene Cooper's article (April 6) on her life and Liberia. It had everything: humanity, a strong and uncommon point of view and lots of historical information. I was amazed how much I learned and felt at the same time -- a rare achievement in a very brief memoir. HARRY JOHNSON
docs.abstract: Dawn Vassel and Harry Johnson letters comment on April 6 Helene Cooper article describing her life in Liberia; James A Smith letter comments on March 30 Benjamin Wallace-Wells article on how suburban demographic shifts affect elections; letters from Judy Wexler, David Greven, Adam Bevelacqua, Jennifer Peeples, Michelle Heeter, David C Balderston and Annmarie Granstrand on March 30 Randall Patterson article about abstinence movements on college campuses; George Hirthler letter comments on March 30 Ilan Greenberg article about groups that are pressuring China on human rights; Fred Ehrman letter comments on March 16 Noah Feldman article about resurgence of Shariah law in Islamic world; letters from George Villarreal and Deborah Walker on March 16 Alissa Quart article on transsexuals on women's college campuses

docs.lead_paragraph: ''There is nothing wrong with it it's not illegal. But it's ugly.'' William H. Gross, chief investment officer of Pimco, on the sky-high earnings of top hedge fund managers. Combined, the top 50 earned $29 billion last year.

docs.lead_paragraph: April is the month for considering financial-aid offers from colleges and universities. This is not a typical year, however. Good news first: the trend toward no-loan packages at top colleges. Now, the bad: an economy in turmoil and more than 55 lenders withdrawing from the system of federally guaranteed student loans. Will there be trouble securing a loan? How do you compare aid packages? What is this thing called need, anyway?Five financial-aid directors - Sarah Clark Donahue of Harvard, Caesar T. Storlazzi of Yale, Kent McGowan of Buffalo State College (State University of New York), Ronald W. Johnson of the University of California, Los Angeles, and Jorge Rodriguez of St. John's University, in New York City - address reader questions, both personal and general, until April 22.

headline.main: College and Money: Ask the Expert
